title: How to Add Text to a Photo in PhotoPad

steps.headline: Open PhotoPad on your computer and add the image file you would like to add text to.
steps.description: You can use the Photo Browser option to import your image or just drag it directly into PhotoPad.

steps.headline: Select the Tools tab in the top navigation menu.
steps.description: From there, you can click on the Text button. A text box will appear on your image and you will see a new text layer open in the layers panel on the right hand side of the program. Use your keyboard to type whatever you would like directly into the text box.

steps.headline: Change the font style, size, positioning, and color.
steps.description: The text layer you have just created has several effects and adjustments you can choose from. Look to the right side of the program under your text layers panel to find these. Click on the Font Face dropdown menu to select a new font style. Click on the color bar to launch the Edit Colors window and choose a new color for your font. Use the arrow next to the font size box to adjust the size of your font. You can also type a font size directly into the box. Set the alignment of your text to the top, bottom, or middle, or to the left, right, or center.

steps.headline: Apply any additional text effects you would like from the bottom of your text layer effects menu.
steps.description: Click on the box next to the effect to apply that effect to your text and then adjust your effect by choosing colors and levels for that effect. You can choose text effects such as drop shadow, inner glow, outer glow, and bevel and emboss. You can also adjust the opacity of your text to make it more or less transparent by dragging the slider back and forth.

steps.headline: Save your image.
steps.description: When you are done editing and adjusting your text, you can click anywhere outside of the text box to see your finished result. Now you can save your new image with text on it in your preferred file format and you are all set.
